intro: Lasiobema dolichobotrys, commonly known as the long-stalked leathery vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its thick, woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
